title: The Dino beach
text:
As you all know this is the famous, most Instagram-ed icon of Bali and Indonesia... the beach that looks like a dinosaur head. Though we didn't get the chance to trek down to the beach itself the view from above was just mind-blowing.
One of the most beautiful places in Bali, this beach is still to be developed as most roads are bad and the trail down is dangerous, but still its beauty is unmatched. A must visit stop in Bali!

title: One of the most beautiful sites in the world!
text:
I'd heard a lot about the acropolis and was always on my list of places to visit and last year we finally made it there. what a majestic structure, as we walked up the stairs towards the main gate the imposing greek columns just makes you stare in disbelief.

We walked up to the main temple premises and spent more than an hour walking across the complex and taking in the magnificent view of Athens from the top. There were a lot of tourists and the environment was so nice. We enjoyed every moment of it. The temple and its history was amazing and the still standing columns just makes one wonder about the might of the ancient Greeks!

title: The best beaches I have ever been to
text:
This is a fantastic beach. The sand is so fine it just slips through your fingers and pulls you in. The waves are mild and the water is crystal clear. One can see right through to the sea bed and the fishes swimming around.
The beach is relatively small, may be less than a km in length but the view is just amazing. We reached there when it was raining and in an hour there was clear sunlight and the beach just lights up, the white sand and the blue sea with the rocks at the end and the hills behind is a sight not to miss. The crown is global and the shack on the beach serves good food.

A must visit at Seychelles!

title: A very nice stay with a great view
text:
We came for our honeymoon and stayed for four nights. The best part of the resort is the view, we had the front seat view of the sunrise on the Indian Ocean straight from the bed. The second best thing was the bathroom, huge, spacious and just loved the shower. The room is quite spacious with a huge balcony where we had a couple of dinners.
The staff is very friendly and the breakfast was awesome, lot of items and all really good. A very nice stay and we just loved the pool and the room.
place: DoubleTree By Hilton Seychelles - Allamanda Resort And Spa

title: A magnificent castle providing one of the best views of Lisbon
text:
First of all you need to walk a little uphill to reach the place.
But once you are in, the first thing you encounter is the courtyard with a cafe on one side and a great view of the city on the other. You can see entire Lisbon from here.

The castle is quite big with a grand entrance and multiple inner walls. One can go to the top of the walls and walk around. You get a nice view of the castle and the grounds along with that of the city. Definitely a great place to start your lisbon trip.

title: A small beautiful church in Copenhagen
text: The marble church is so called as it is made completely out of marble and the white look is gorgeous. It is a small church with very high ceiling but really beautiful.

title: The best view in Dubai
text:
After some hassle at the Dubai Mall, we finally found our way to the entrance to Burj Khalifa. The best part of the whole thing was the lift. 125 floors in under a minute...amazing!

Then the view. You can see the entirety of Dubai from up there. The view is just amazing. You can also move out at an area as a balcony and get some awesome pics of the city below.

title: Beautiful deserted Island in faro
text:
This place is just amazing. An island with a fantastic beach and deserted.
I walked for more than an hour on the beach, half way through there was one lady ahead of me and then there was no one around. Not a soul in sight. The peace and quiet and the splashing waves are just amazing. If one wants some alone time, this is the place to be.

title: A must visit place in Portugal
text:
This place is like the best in Portugal. A ferry ride from lagos port, you get to enter these beautiful water caves, they just take your breath away.
There are a lot of small beaches along the way and one can choose to do the entire trip by kayaking. I choose the traditional motor boat and our Captain was a jolly fellow who have us a running commentary on the caves and how some of them looked like Elephants and Horses.
The best part is when they take the boat right in the cave and you can see the greenish blue hue in the water. Its just awesome. A must for everyone!

title: The most beautiful place in Seville
text:
This cathedral is not just a historic monument but an everlasting piece of art. First of all the city itself is very beautiful and the people and the streets all around you just makes the place some alive.
And right in the middle of it is this beautiful monument. The entrance is not that amazing but once I stepped in, my mind was blown. The arches and the ceiling is some 5 floors high with intimate decoration. There are small chapels all around the periphery and on the right of the main alter is the tomb of Christopher Columbus!
The tomb is so beautifully made, it shows the significance this discoverer has in Spain. The main alter itself is huge and bared by gates. Its beauty is like no other. There are these huge organ pipes and tall doors, all of these comes together to create sucha magnificent effect!

title: The must go place in Barcelona
text:
The Sagrada Familia is the top place of attraction in Barcelona. The towers that cover both sides are a sight for the sore eyes. There are always a lot of people and one needs to book the tickets online for a specific time-slot. The tickets are a little expesive but worth it.
The Cathedral itself is huge with high ceilings and a mix of both old and modern architecture. The Cathedral has been in construction for many years now and still not complete. The entire place is made to be acoustically sound, so when the choir plays, you the audience gets to really hear the chords.
The main attraction here is that they take you up on the towers, on one side via a lift and one needs to walk down from there. You get an awesome view of the entire city and the walk down also gives you good glimpses of the cathedral itself. A beautiful monument!

title: One of the best palaces in Spain
text:
This place is awesome, its a shame they do not allow pictures inside.
Each room is specifically designed for a purpose and in a unique style. There is the porcelain room, where the walls are covered with Spanish green porcelain, no paint no other decoration. The great dining hall has a table that can seat more than 50 people and the chandeliers are so huge, one can sleep inside one.
really beautiful place, gives you an idea of the immense wealth of the Spanish empire.

title: A beautiful park to hang out
text:
First of all the park is huge. It has these beautiful gardens and running tracks and a huge lake right in the middle of it.
The statues in the far bank of the lake give an awesome view and some nice pics. People usually take their time out and spend a lazy afternoon here. Very nice place to chill.

title: One of the best palaces ever!
text:
The Alhambra is just breath-taking. The Gardens are the most amazing site, you just walk through them like a maze. There are small pools and gateways made with the plants.
There are 2 palaces and a fort within the premises. The architecture is Islamic and adorned with texts and arches. The walls have intricate designs and are a work of sheer beauty. The view of the city down below is another site to look out for. One is speechless when she enters the main courtyard, the pool and the buildings on both sides make an amazing site.
One of the top places in Spain to go.

title: The awesome Gardens of Alhambra
text:
Once you enter the premises, the first thing you notice are the beautiful palace gardens and the way to the adjoining palace.
The gardens are mesmerising. You have these huge arches and gateways created by the plants and the small pools in the way. The sound of running water and the view of the palace just takes your breadth away. The adjoining palace has a staircase up for a fantastic view of the city below and the water again flowing beside you at the stairs up.
Amazing place.

title: Food food and food...all you can eat!
text:
This place is a paradise for foodies. A glass enclosed square with food stalls all over. You have everything here, from traditional Spanish food, Turkish baklava, pizzas, amazing collection of sea food, shushi, beer and wine stalls. Everything!

The prices are a little high but I am not complaining. So much food in under one roof is like heaven,. This is the place to be for anyone. The place is buzzing with conversation and people looking at with awe and amazement. The quality of food is very good...

title: The amazing Pena Palace
text:
A beautiful palace in at the top of the hill in Sintra. The first thing to notice as you walk up to the palace are these huge tall trees swaying in the morning wind. Then one notices the fog which blocks your view of the palace and the hill-side.

Once you reach the top, the sheer yellow colour of the palace catches your eye and never lets go. The architecture is amazing, there is this huge sculpture of a monster just above the gateway and the entrance is to he right. One can even walk along the walls of the palace and enjoy the mesmerising view of the fog rolling along the tree tops.

The interior of the palace is a little less amazing than the front but beautiful nonetheless. This is the summer palace of the king of Portugal and once can see it in every hall and room. The most beautiful room is the hall where the king entertained his guests. It has custom made chandeliers, furniture and even the window glass.

This a great place to be.
place: Park and National Palace of Pena

title: National Palace in Sintra
text:
This is the National Palace of Sintra. I landed up here from the Pena Palace and that may be te reason that I didi not like it that much. The Pena palace is amazing with its location and the architecture.
Compared to it the National palace was quite bland. Some of the views like that of the ceiling of the hall and the view of the prince's garden was damn good. The view from up top looking down on the Sintra city, now that is an amazing view. A god place to start, recommended to see before the Pena palace.

title: The tower at the end of Lisbon
text:
The Belem tower is right at the end of Lisbon. The tower looks beautiful and the view of the city from the top is just amazing. You can see the monastery, the bridge and the ships in the water; the whole thing.

They allow only 120 people at a time in the tower and they do it in batches. There is just one staircase up, with steep stairs some 200 of them. Once you reach the top, there is a small landing to enjoy the view and click as many pics as one wants. Nice place and a must see.

title: A fantastic stay in Raintree
text:
First of all the hotel looks amazing. The water falling in front of the place and the grand lobby are just wow. The place is very well designed with so mush light but nothing hurts your eye.
We had our rooms on the 2nd floor. We had a nice view of the street, though a bit restricted. The rooms were big and the spacious, well lit and very clean.The wash rooms were equally good. The breakfast and wifi were complimentary.
We had a very nice stay.

title: One of the best places in Lisbon
text:
The monastery is divided in to 2 sections, the church and the Monestary itself. The church entry is free and it costs 10 euros for the monastery entry.

The church is amazing, high arches and beautiful walls adorned with statues. There are also 2 tombs of famous Portuguese citizens. The main alter is huge and s beautiful.

After the tickets I entered the Monastery and it was just breathtaking. One enters on the first floor and there is this beautiful square in the middle with hallways on all four sides. The most beautiful thing is the view of the dome from the square and next comes the arches in the hallway. One just gets lost in time.

Magnificent.

title: The highest and most beautiful point in the city
text:
I have been to the Birla mandir multiple times in the last few years and went there this January. It was 2nd of Jan and as expected, there were a lot of people going to the temple. After a short walk up the hill, through the market, we left our shoes and mobiles at the clock room and proceeded up the steps.

The thing I like the most is the fact that it is completely made of white marble and the lighting is so good that you can see the temple from miles around. Amidst the shouts of 'Govinda' we entered the premises and paid our homage to Lord vishnu and then settled down on the open spaces to enjoy the view of the Hussain Sagar lake and necklace road along with the cool breeze. The view from up there is really beautiful, something that draws a lot of people here.

A very well maintained and beautiful place.

title: The oldest catholic church in Rome!
text:
The first thing I remember of the Pantheon is from the novel Angels and Demons and the movie of the same name. When we landed up there, a crowd was gathered as the church was closed for some dignitaries. After a 15 mins wait we finally entered the Pantheon.
The first thing to notice was the obelisk at the top and the beautiful walls that surround you. The atmosphere is pleasant and calming. A really beautiful church.

We visited in October 2013.

title: The place of the Gladiators
text:
The best attraction Rome has to offer is the Colosseum.
This remarkable and beautiful monument was constructed during the Fabian dynasty by its three emperors. The place is huge, and i mean huge. After a 30 min wait in the queue we bought our tickets with a guide and reached the designated place for the tour. Then a lady took our group of some 20 people to the centre of the Colosseum and told us its entire history. We also went to the 3rd floor which gives a great view of the entire pace and Rome nearby.

One of the best places I have ever been to. We went in Oct 2013.

title: Towering...Stunning...Beautiful!
text:
Eiffel Tower needs no Introduction.
It is an engineering marvel and one of the must visit places in the world. We went there via the metro, came out of the station and I was just blown. The place is beautiful, you have the open green fields that just keeps on going and this huge tower above you. It makes you feel small. Plus when the lights go up, you just fall in love with it.

We went there in Oct 2013.

title: The underground water tunnels
text:
One of the best attractions in Istanbul and just beside the Hagia Sophia are the Basilica Cisterns.
During the eastern roman empire, it functioned as the underground water reservoir for the city and the water was brought in from a nearby lake. The best part of this place are the stone columns that support the reservoir. Out of them there are two columns that are supported on the heads of Medusa; one is sidewise and the other is upside down.

Really nice place to have cool walk and nice pics.

title: A nice cozy chic place to put up
text:
The hotel is in the lime colour. One part of the room is green in colour even the bathroom basin is green, but the contrast with white is damn good. The rooms are decently big and bathrooms are very clean.
You have the breakfast buffet at the ground floor near the reception. Great looks, good budget and very well located.

title: A damn good hotel
text:
Well the first good thing was the complimentary pick up and drop to the airport. The security is a little tight but I am not complaining. The lobby is huge and the staff are really helpful.

We got a nice room at a good discount from one of the online sites. The bed was huge and the view was really nice. The bathroom was a little small but clean and well maintained.

A good option to stay near the Airport.

title: A happening place in Istanbul
text:
We stayed in the Sultanahmet district during our visit and the place is amazing. First of all 4 of the best attractions in Istanbul are in Sultanahmet - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cisterns and The Topkapi Palace. Plus there is a huge market just stone's throw from the Blue Mosque.
Sultanahmet is the perfect blend of history and modern age. One one hand you have the monuments that are hundreds of years old; telling the rich story of Istanbul while just at walking distance you have a Burger King.
A very nice place to stay, shop and enjoy!

We visited in August 2014.

title: The beautiful St. Peter's Basilica
text:
We visited in Oct 2013

We landed up at the nearest metro station and walked up to the wall surrounding Vatican. My first glimpse was the blue dome and I was struck by how magnificent and towering it was.
But I was wrong. When you enter St Peter's Square you start to feel so small in front of this towering monument. The square was huge and there was this huge queue and the sun blazing down on us. We waited for almost 3 hours in the queue and finally got admitted to the Basilica.
Then we took the 500+ steps to the top and clicked some awesome pics of Rome and the square. That sight from the top of the Basilica is just priceless, no one should miss it. From up there you also get a birds eye view of the inside. from up there people inside look like ants.

Then we finally entered St. Peters and were just blown. The sheer size of the place is staggering, you have these beautiful flawless statues and sculptures across all the walls and pillars, its just amazing. The Pietà my Michelangelo was the only sculpture enclosed in a glass case, and it is just beautiful.

No one should miss this, and I am sure, for centuries people will be flocking to this beautiful Basilica.

title: The Elephant and Dolphin shows are the best
text:
This is a place for friends and family alike.
First we went around the open zoo. There were tigers, giraffes, neel gai, and numerous other animals and birds in the park.

The park is huge and we were able to cover The Orang Utang show, Dolphin show and Cowboy show. The Dolphin show was the best as you see those beautiful animals jump out of the water and their trainers taking them around and even riding them. The orang Utang show was cute, there were small and large apes playing bands and jumping around the place. The Cowboy show was a little downer but overall a nice trip.

Great place to go!

title: A nice retreat near Pattaya
text:
This is a place for tigers and much more. We watched the Tiger Show, Elephant show and the Crocodile show.
The tiger show felt like being in a circus, some half a dozen tigers in a cage doing stunts at the snap of the whip. Nice stunts and the tigers look magnificent.
The Elephant show was quite hilarious as you see them lining up and parading up and down the stage. They throw darts. quite accurately, I might say and also have acts involving the audience.
The crocodile show is the scariest. The trainers put their hands, legs and even their heads between the jaws of the crocs. Quite good.

title: Amazing and Imposing place
text:
We were staying in Sultanahmet and the Blue mosque was walking distance from our hotel. The entrance to the mosque is grand and imposing. All of us have seen it in movies but as you walk in you feel small, and exhilarated. The porch is filled with people and its a nice feel to just sit there and the chatter around you take hold.
The entrance is from the side and there are racks where they offer you clothes to cover your head and body before entering the mosque. The mosque is extremely well preserved, the walls the decorated ceilings all are just mesmerising. You will be just captivated!

P.S. We visited in August 2014

title: An imposing temple beside the Yamuna
text:
First of all this place is huge and second they have mot spared any expense in building this place. You can just roam around the place and easily spend 30-40 mins in doing so. The main temple building is right at the centre and a huge boulevard welcomes you in.
The architecture of the place is amazing, there are elephants and crocs a pool surrounding the main temple, all magnificent. Beautiful place.

title: The largest Little India ever
text:
First of all, this place is huge. There is a famous mall called Mustafa mall, you will get anything you want here. There are scores of restaurants and I spotted the familiar name of Saravana Bhawan.
The best part of this place are the open spaces and some nice hotels where you will find all the Indian tourists in Singapore. A nice place for any Indian to spend some quality time. When we visited it was Dusshera and the whole place was lit and decorated, felt like walking to a mundap in Kolkata.

title: One of the best views of Istanbul
text:
The Gallata tower is very well located and gives you a great view of Istanbul. One takes the lift to the top and walk around the restaurant there and take a lot of pics.
You can see the harbour, the bridge and can just soak in the beauty of Istanbul. A must visit for everyone going to this historic city.

We visited in August 2014.

title: A must visit in Singapore
text:
Our guide told us that the Night Safari was the outcome of a $30 mn investment and one of the best in the world. First I was a little skeptical, but when I saw the white proud African Lion sitting just 10 meters from me, I was sold.
We were lucky as a couple of White African lions were on loan to the zoo and not everyone gets to see that. Then there were the elephants, the bears and neel gais and many other beautiful creatures.
The next awesome thing was the lighting. It seems as if there is moonlight throughout the place and they have been especially designed to be light on the eyes of the animals and give a perfect view to the tourists.

title: One of the most mesmerising sites in Rome
text: We were walking to the Pantheon and suddenly there was a huge crowd and they were looking at the wall opposite. When I turned my head, I was just bowled. This huge fountain and the magnificent sculptures just overwhelmed me and then it struck that this was the Trevi fountain. No doubt one of the best sites in Rome, bustling with tourists and the fountain filled with coins, the gushing water and laughter all around you is just awesome.

title: Hot and happening place
text:
A must visit in Pattaya.
Clubs and pubs, Strip clubs and Sex shows, live music and booze and food, there is something for everyone here. Just keep walking and you will find a place that will suit you.
The Russian club and Tony's place are especially good, do try them out.

title: A must visit in Singapore
text:
The Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore, though there are many of these in the country the one opposite Marina bay sands is the most popular and a must visit for anyone landing up in Singapore.
The actual name of Singapore is Singhapura, land of lion and being originally a fishing village, the Merlion is a perfect embodiment of the spirit of Singapore with a head of a lion and body of a fish.

title: A birds eye view of Singapore
text:
Built just like the London eye, standing at 165 meters, this the place to see the all of Singapore. From the top you can get a view of the entire island of Singapore. The Marina bay hotel looks awesome and the Singapore river is mercerising from that height.

A must do in Singapore, unless of course you have been on the London eye

title: A amazing way to reach Sentosa Island
text:
The cable car connects Singapore to Sentosa Island. There are two stops in Sentosa, we took the car to the first one. The best part of the ride is obviously the view. The Singapore harbour on one side and water below, just beautiful.
Do take the ride to Sentosa!

title: A beautiful 360 degree view of Kuala Lumpur
text: One of the tallest towers in South-east Asia, KL tower gives a beautiful view of the city, especially the Petronas towers. A few shops for chocolates and snacks and binoculars for a zoomed in view. Nice place.

title: Nice place walking distance from the beach
text:
The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just behind the Hilton, it is at 5 mins walk from the beach. The market is just beside the hotel and a 10 mins tuk tuk ride will bring you to the Walking street.
The buffet was really good, we had options of American and Indian buffets. The american was damn good but the Indian was much lacking in options.
The rooms are spacious, but the balconies are open so no privacy there.

title: A majestic monument
text:
The Hagia Sophia is huge. Standing in front of it you just feel so small and once you enter, you are just blown by the sheer beauty of the place.
The artwork and the paintings around the place are so beautiful and so well preserved over centuries. I especially loved the chandeliers and the library enclosed in beautiful art work panels. There is also nice viewing spot where you can see the Blue Mosque right across the garden in between them.
This place just stays with you, a really memorable experience.

title: Very nice hotel with a grand breakfast
text:
A nice hotel with big rooms and one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had. We were at the 6th floor and the view was nice...open places with the city at the edge. The lobby was huge and well decorated.
The breakfast had some 50 items with traditional Malaysian food, noodles, live omelette and waffles counter. Really good bfast.

title: Beautiful place and a must go if you end up in Kuala Lumpur
text:
This place is big, divided into 5 theme parks: Water park, Extreme Sports, Amusement park, Scary House and Wildlife park.
The thing I liked the best was the hanging bridge over the park, one of the longest in the world and the view from up there is just awesome. The rides in the amusement park are good but the best part are the adventure sports. One can bungee jump, go kart of fly on a line over the park.
The biggest attraction is the artificial beach and wave park right in the middle and it is also the biggest attraction here.

title: One of the best gardens I have been to
text:
Now this is a proper greenhouse. The gardens are divided into two parts - one for flowers and the other has the cloud walk.

We went to the flower garden first. I was just overwhelmed with the variety of flowers and plant they have here. Plus it is just exquisitely beautiful. You also get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, an added view to look forward to.

The cloud walk is just breathtaking. Just in front of the entrance is the highest man-made waterfall. Then we took the elevator to the top and started walking down. The cloud walk is aptly named as there is a cloud-like atmosphere all around and as expected, the view is awesome. You are just transported to a different place.

A must visit in Singapore!

title: Excellent Day @ Universal Studios Singapore
text:
This is a must visit place in Singapore. Located in the Sentosa Island, Universal Studios is simply one of the best spots in Singapore.

The park is themed after different movies and television shows, 6 to be exact. They are the Madagascar, Shrek, Jurassic Park, Mummy, Si-fi world (Transformers and Battlestar Gallactica) and Sesame Street. The Water world show was cancelled due to haze on our visit.

Some of the must see attractions in order:
1. Transformers 3D show
2. Battlestar Galactica (Blue and Red rides) - Only for the strong hearted!
3. Revenge of the Mummy ride
4. Jurassic Park water ride
5. Shrek 4D show

This place has great restaurants and rides for everyone in the family, from kids to grandparents and all in the middle. A great place to spend a day.

title: A very beautiful show
text:
So we were brought to this Colosseum theatre for the Alcazar show. A truly remarkable show, excellent lighting and gorgeous sets. The costumes are especially beautiful just like the people.
A must see for everyone who visits Pattaya.

title: One of the most beautiful and well preserved places in Scandinavia.
text:
Suomenlinna Island was suggested to us by a few friends we met in Stockholm. We immediately decided to take the take the overnight cruise and landed at the port in the morning. A short ferry ride and we were at Suomenlinna.

It was a nice small island a few houses here and there but the scenery was breathtaking. The chapel, the fort the small river running down the middle of the island. We roamed around the place for hours, from one end to the other. My favourite was the place with the guns and the hillside overlooking the sea.

I had visited it on September 2013.

title: One of the most beautiful places I have been to!
text:
The old city is awesome!
We entered the place in the afternoon with the waves lashing at the shore and the lights just coming on. The sound, the view and the company, it was a really great experience for us. The small restaurants in the old city and the walking within the high walls, you are surrounded by history and magnificence.
In the docks just at the other end of the were docked some 50 boats and the view of the city walls from that side is just mesmerising. This is a must visit for all tourists out there. No doubt it is an UNESCO world heritage site!

Disclaimer: I had visited in November 2013.

title: A beautiful palace with a great view of the lake
text:
The Udaipur palace is one of the must see places in Udaipur. On the bank of Lake Pichola, it stands tall, a symbol of beauty and power. The entrance is a huge gate some 40 feet tall and through it you walk into the garden. There are restaurants and small shops selling different items.

The route across the palace is a one way. The route is beautifully planned that takes you from the big halls up the tower for a view of the lake and then down again to a host of galleries. There are the pictures and belongings of different Kings in a chronological order up till the present prince. The palace is a must see for all who are planning to see the city of lakes!

title: A museum to envy
text:
Note: We went to the Louvre in October 2013.

The Louvre needs no introduction. The home of the Mona Lisa and pieces of history that had shaped the world more than once.

The first thing that I noticed as soon as I came out of the metro station was the magnificence of this great structure. The entrance itself is mesmerising and the moment I enters the foyer with the glass pyramid standing proud in the centre, I felt why this is one of the greatest museums in the world.

We stood in queue for some 30 minutes and entered the main waiting and ticketing area; it was huge. There are three part and likewise three entrances to the museum. We spent some 5-6 hours in the museum and covered as many parts as we could. My most favourite part of the museum was the part that housed the belongings of Emperor Napoleon. The huge dining table and the huge chandeliers, they made you feel small!

And of course the Mona Lisa! After a little struggle I was able to take a clear picture of this masterpiece. The place was thronged with patrons from all over the world and it really took some effort to reach to the front.

Apart from these we also visited the paintings, the sculptures and the Egyptian section. A great place to spend a day. I strongly recommend to spend an entire day at this awesome place!

title: One of the greatest work of the Eastern Roman Empire
text:
A marvel of engineering located at the heart of Istanbul are the Basilica Cisterns. The underground attraction is thronged by tourists. The water here was used to provide for the entire city at one point in time. The most important attraction here are the Medusa heads, one placed sideways and the other is inverted, they are at the end of the underground hall.

A beautiful piece of engineering!

title: The best Palace museums in the World
text:
Just behind the Hagia Sofia, is the enormous entrance to the Topkapi Palace. The first gate lets you inside the Palace premises, a huge lawn and an excellent view of the sea.

Some 5 minutes walk from the first gate and you can find throngs of tourists in queue to get their tickets to the Palace premises. There are two types of tickets - One is only entrance to the Palace and the other is Palace and the Harem (The Royal Family's quarters).

The Palace has many buildings, with different sights to offer. The first building houses the treasures of the Eastern Roman Empire. There resides the famous and magnificent Topkapi Diamond. Many more jewels, ornate daggers and swords adorn the walls, well preserved in their glass chambers. There are some rooms show casing the sitting areas, open spaces giving an amazing view of the ocean and the city.
After a long walk across many stairs and small rooms, we ended in what I would say is the best collection I have ever seen - The belongings of the Prophets! The sword of Prophet David, the clothes of Prophet Mohammed and the Staff of Prophet Moses; among many possessions of unbelievable significance to the world.
The Harem actually pales to the significance of these collections but nonetheless are so well decorated and maintained that it just grips you in awe. The intricate work adorning the walls the views and most importantly the ceilings, just breathtaking!

This is one of the best attractions I have ever seen and a must go for all those out there who crave to see such immeasurable beauty, culture and history all blended in one!
